Package traer.physics

Interface Summary
Force This interface specifies the basic mechanics of a Force.
 

Class Summary
AbstractForce A skeletal implementation of Force covering the methods concerned with the on/off state.
Attraction This class implements TwoBodyForce to represent an inverse-square law force with a force constant and minimal distance.
BackwardEulerIntegrator  
Drag  
ForwardEulerIntegrator  
Function<From,To>  
Gravity  
Integrator  
ModifiedEulerIntegrator  
Particle A Class for representing a Particle; contains the Particle's position, velocity, and the force on the Particle as Vector3Ds.
ParticleSystem  
RungeKuttaIntegrator  
SettlingRungeKuttaIntegrator  
Spring This class implements TwoBodyForce to represent a Spring with a spring constant, damping factor, and ideal length.
TargettedForce A Force that has it's subject Particles already specified, and hence does not support the Force.apply(Particle) method.
TwoBodyForce TwoBodyForce is Force between two specified Particles, which extends TargettedForce and simplifies implementation of custom Forces.
TwoBodyForce.ForcePair This class wraps Vector3D forces to apply to the two ends of this TwoBodyForce.
UniversalForce A Force that is applied to Particles at the user's discretion, and hence does not support the Force.apply() method.
Vector3D The Vector3D class used for representing 3D vectors and the operations on them.
 

Enum Summary
Integrator.METHOD
